captions.text:
This year, we got you the trailer you requested
the most

After 42 volumes of comics, 18 movies, and
15 seasons of television...

one live action adaptation will ignore everything
people loved about the Dragon Ball franchise

in America’s biggest insult to Japanese
culture since Hiroshima.

Prepare for Fox’s half-assed attempt to
cash in on their expiring rights to Dragon

It’s an adaptation that steals from everything
except the source material,

"Shadow Crane strike is the most basic of
all the air-bending techniques."

When the Sith Lord Piccolo escapes his ancient
prison, somehow...

Goku, a student at video game high school,
must find the dragon balls before something

about an eclipse or else something about Oozaru
the evil monkey werewolf.
Can I get a little help here?

We’ll take it from here Honest Trailer Voice
Man Voice!

Alright, listen up! Dragon Ball is the epic
saga of a martial artist who...
This is an outrage! I never went to school!

Anyway, it’s about Noku here’s quest to
collect all 7 wish granting dragon balls before--
Whoa, when did I get a hot Asian sidekick?
Maybe this movie isn’t so bad.
"I am Muten Roshi, the Invincible! Hahahaha!"

And along the way Goku is joined by his best
friend Krillin, who should
be showing up in the movie any second now...

I gotta be honest guys, this still seems pretty
stupid.
But, like, the show is way better!

I fly around on a magic cloud, fight a shapeshifting
man pig...
And help a 300 year old man get laid!
Not really. But thanks for trying.

You bet! Bye bye Honest Trailer Man Voice
Man!

Power up for a movie that doesn’t just sound
bad, it looks bad,

as the epic ki attacks from the cartoons are
replaced with CGI hand farts.

Squirm as the awkward level goes over 9000,
in a movie full of
"Grandpa! I'm so happy to see you!"
So, gather up all of the balls

for the one wish that everyone can agree on:
make this movie never exist!

How dare they make a movie about Kakarot and
not include me?
I’m Vegeta, prince of the Saiya--
oh my god is that the Beta-Male?
He's like a Tiger with Down’s Syndrome.
Definitely. Would you like to do the honors?
Oh, God, What a steaming pile.

So wait, Kakarot wishes a guy he just met
back to life at the end of the movie,

but he lets the man who raised him from birth
stay dead?
Special thanks to Team Four Star.

And if you want to get us something for Christmas,
be sure to click that subscribe button.

comments.author: vanshdeep sharma

comments.text:
Usually when they make a movie based on animes or video games, it goes like 
this:
1.They search around titles which have a large audience. 
2.They go shopping and buy the rights to use the title to make a movie (you 
can also blame the japanese who sell the rights without any restrictions or 
any supervisions on how the final product will be. It was funny how Uwe 
Boll was kicked out by Blizzard when he tried to buy the rights for a 
Warcraft movie)
3. The most idiotic movie producer gets the oportunity to make the movie, 
who never even saw the show, he doesn't have ANY idea what is about.
4. That movie producer takes a pen and a paper and is asking a guy who saw 
the movie to tell him a couple of things about who the fuck the characters 
are and what the fuck is the story about. It goes like this:
"So about the characters..."
"well there's this guy Goku, he's strong, he can beat others...."
"Okay... Goku...strong...throws kicks and punches, noted. Enough about him, 
next"
"later he marries with ChiChi..."
"Chichi... wife. noted. NEXT!"
"there's Yamcha, Bulma..."
"are those women?"
"Bulma is a girl..."
"...girl. Okay, others"
"His... his grandfather Gohan finds him and raises him but later dies"
"Bulma's?"
"No, Goku's grandfather. And later He's trained by Roshi, who's living 
alone in a..."
"Yeah, okay what's the plot?"
"Well there are seven Dragon Balls to be collected which can Summon Shenron 
and the dragon is making your wish come true..."
"Ooookay... Thank you. And send me an email with some pictures about how 
those dragonballs look like. See you later then."
"That's enough? I mean he has friends and others that might be important to 
the story"
"There are enough characters. I have to go now, I have an appointment"
5. This movie producer makes a movie based on that information given to him 
in a short time.

And they do exactly this with MANY titles. Those guys who are making the 
movies NEVER saw the anime, or games they made movies about. They just 
bought the rights based on the numbers of audiences. That is a real insult.﻿
